citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection several bottles of medications, supplements as well as two open syringes were stored on the top
of a dog enclosure. A bottle of Metronidazole was identified with an expiration date of Jan 2025 along with an Iron
supplement with an expiration date of 4/20. Medication beyond its expiration date could lose the ability to be effective, and
does not constitute the standard of care. In addition, medication and needles and syringes must be stored in a sanitary
manner. The licensee must ensure that all medication is properly stored and any expired medication is removed from use
in the kennel. The licensee corrected this issue by disposing of the expired medication and moving the medication and
supplies at the time of inspection.
********Corrected on 2/20/25

Records for two litters born at the facility did not contain the required information. The date of birth for both litters have
been recorded however, no additional information was documented. Records shall be maintained for litters born at the
facility and must include the sex, breed type, a date of birth, and color. Records shall be maintained for each dog held at
the facility and must include the information as required by this section of the AWA, including any offspring.
*****Correct by March 15, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At the time of inspection several bottles of medications, supplements as well as two open syringes were stored on the top 
of a dog enclosure. A bottle of Metronidazole was identified with an expiration date of Jan 2025 along with an Iron 
supplement with an expiration date of 4/20. Medication beyond its expiration date could lose the ability to be effective, and 
does not constitute the standard of care. In addition, medication and needles and syringes must be stored in a sanitary 
manner. The licensee must ensure that all medication is properly stored and any expired medication is removed from use 
in the kennel. The licensee corrected this issue by disposing of the expired medication and moving the medication and 
supplies at the time of inspection.  
********Corrected on 2/20/25 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records for two litters born at the facility did not contain the required information. The date of birth for both litters have 
been recorded however, no additional information was documented. Records shall be maintained for litters born at the 
facility and must include the sex, breed type, a date of birth, and color. Records shall be maintained for each dog held at 
the facility and must include the information as required by this section of the AWA, including any offspring. 
*****Correct by March 15, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
